On August 28, 2025, Bajaj Auto Ltd. was reported to be experiencing a significant production cut of its Chetak electric scooter due to a shortage of rare-earth metals . The company's market share in the electric two-wheeler segment subsequently halved in August.

Production cut of Chetak electric scooter: AnAl Jazeeraarticle, published on August 28, detailed how a global shortage of rare-earth metals forced Bajaj Auto to significantly reduce the production of its Chetak electric scooter. The article states that Bajaj produced just 10,824 Chetak units in July, nearly halving its output compared to the 20,384 units made in the same period last year.

Impact on market share: This production issue contributed to a considerable drop in Bajaj Auto's electric vehicle (EV) market share. A report published later, on September 1, indicates that the company's EV market share declined from 22% in July to 11% in August, moving it to the fifth spot in the segment. The report also mentions that rival Ather Energy saw a market share increase during the same period.

Analysts' commentary on GST: A report from Jefferies on August 28 included commentary on the potential impact of a possible Goods and Services Tax (GST) reduction on the automotive sector. While the report did not focus specifically on Bajaj Auto, it noted that two-wheelers and small passenger vehicles would likely benefit most from such a cut.
